datasource: Hayward, Richard, 1978. 'Bayso revisited. Some preliminary linguistic observations, Part I'. Bulletin of the School of African and Asian Studies. 41/4. pp. 539–570; Hayward, Richard, 1979. 'Bayso revisited. Some preliminary linguistic observations, Part II'. Bulletin of the School of African and Asian Studies. 41/4. pp. 101-132.[H78;H79
datasourceNotes: Note that all verbs are Suffix conjugation, except for the very marginal case of the encliticized Copula. [LOOK UP NEGATIVE JUSSIVE]
geodemoTXT: Representing the northern branch of the Omo-Tana language sub-family, Bayso is spoken in villages in the vicinity of, and islands in Lake Abaya.
